attributes.action: SIA frontline officers to be granted with more power and equipted with PPE
attributes.background: Security Officers deal with violent and aggressive and drunken individuals each day, thus they are vulnerable in frontline. They have no powers apart from Common Law powers and have no Personal Protective Equipment.
attributes.additional_details: Each day we see in media of security officers been attacked,stabbed or even more been killed. We are asking government to grant powers to Security Officers and make Personal Protective Equipment mandatory throught the industry. This way, our security officer colleagues will be safe in frontline.

attributes.action: hold a referendum on  giving 0.7% of GDP in foreign aid.
attributes.background: Call on the British government to hold a referendum on giving 0.7% of GDP to foreign aid

attributes.action: Force food outlets to display a Capital H sign if they use Halal meat.
attributes.background:
Many food outlets are using and selling us Halal meat without our knowledge.
This meat has come from the barbaric practice of slitting the the animals throat without stunning them first. They are hung upside down and left to bleed to death. You deserve the right to know what you are eating.
attributes.additional_details: You should be able to clearly see if a food outlet is using Halal meat. You should be able to make an educated choice before buying.

attributes.action: Implement & enforce an improved code of professional conduct for MPs in session.
attributes.background:
Revise the MPs code of conduct to include:
Respect
Driving positive behaviours
Setting the example of professional conduct
Reinforcing to the public that MPs work for a shared goal, regardless of party allegiance
Presenting sessions of the British parliament in a positive light to the World
attributes.additional_details:
MPs have a duty and obligation to us, the electorate, to set the standards of positive British values.  Jeering, laughing, mocking, name calling, shouting etc would not be tolerated in day to day life and should not be accepted during sessions of parliament.  Many of these in fact constitute bullying.

A thorough reform of policy / conduct is required to improve behavior by those elected to represent us, with ongoing powers to enforce and hold those in breech to account.  Promote British Values.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke within 20 metres of a school during school hours
attributes.background:
As a parent, I find it disgusting that when taking my child to school, I have to take my child though clouds of cigarette smoke.

I am not anti-smoking, but I do believe that it should not be forced on children. When parents stand outside a school and are smoking, the kids suffer as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm an ex-smoker and believe that smokers have rights. However, children have a right to not be subjected to cigarette smoke right outside a centre for education.

Every day when I take my son to school, there are groups of parents in a haze of cigarette smoke, and it's unavoidable. If parents cannot show restraint for the health of their children, then the Government should intervene and make it a criminal offence.

attributes.action: All elections should be on Saturday's to stop disrupting children's education.
attributes.background: Presently local and national elections are held on Thursdays.Hundreds of schools are used as polling stations disrutpting the education of thousands of children and means parents and carers are forced to make childcare arrangements for their child as their schools are being closed for Election Day.

attributes.action: David Cameron to acknowledge that Freemantle statistics have been misrepresented
attributes.background: The changes being imposed by the government regarding the Junior Doctor contract are based around the Freemantle Paper into weekend hospital admissions. The government frequently use these figures to justify claims for their changes to contracts which directly contradicts the authors conclusions.
attributes.additional_details:
The authors report 11,000 deaths on Friday, Saturday, Sunday and Monday admissions compared to the other days. They also note there is a higher proportion of "unwell" patients. They do not suggest these are avoidable.  A paper published by Lord Darzi this year looking at avoidability of hospital deaths suggests that only 3.6% are avoidable. 

The Prime Minister must abide by medical research ethics and confirm that the goverment are misrepresenting data for political kudos.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum annual leave entitlement from 5.6 weeks to 7.6 weeks
attributes.background:
The increasing retirement age leaves far less to look forward to at the end of our working lives. We are asking for increased minimum annual leave entitlements during our working lives to compensate for this loss.

This will give us more time with our families and to follow our own interests.
attributes.additional_details:
Retirement age is increasing (to be 66 by 2020). Estimates are that when today's teenagers retire, the retirement age will be 75. People currently look forward to retirement but with increasing age there are fewer possibilities for those years.

Give us extra leave during our working years so that we can feel that we have lives and interests beyond work. It will reduce stress and exhaustion as well as increase happiness.

We will benefit, our children will benefit, our employers will benefit.

attributes.action: Abuse & Vandalism to UK War Graves & Monuments should carryBig Prison sentences.
attributes.background: It is now becoming common place for us to see Vandalism or Urination on Our Countries War Monuments & War Graves. It is Absolutely unacceptable! The Criminal/s involved have no respect or Morals. But they get nothing more than a Fine or Community service which is far to lenient for a Sentence.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/643407/urinate-World-War-One-memorial-cenotaph-vandal-St-Peters-square-Manchester-police

attributes.action: Make train operators legally provide adjustments for passengers with autism.
attributes.background: People with autistic spectrum disorder (ASD) experience sensory difficulties. Train operators are failing to provide or enforce, quiet carriages, or other areas free of noise, distraction or bright lights. Passengers with hidden disabilities deserve adjustments too. We demand a statory requirement.
attributes.additional_details: Passengers with autism are being forced to sit on the carpet between carriages, challenge other passengers, to get distressed, go into meltdown or experience anxiety, simply because train operators won't cater for their needs. Complaints are dismissed and excuses such as availability, company policy are trotted out by train companies. The Equality Act is not being enforced for those with hidden disabilities and sensory impairments. We demand a new statutory duty for compliance and adjustments.

attributes.action: Fair and regulated pricing for EV charging points within the UK.
attributes.background: Ecotricity today 7th July 2016 increased the price of EV charging from free to £5 per a 20 minute charge. They apparently consulted EV drivers and consider this to be a fair price. The new pricing makes long distance travel not economically viable with an EV.

attributes.action: British Isles devolution to allow regions to choose RemaIN in the EU or Leave.
attributes.background: Mainland Denmark is in the EU, whilst devolved Greenland and Faroe Islands are in Denmark but not in the EU. Great Britain and Northern Ireland are in the UK and therefore the EU, while the Isles of Jersey, Guernsey and Man are in the British Isles but not in the UK or the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
Areas of England and Wales that wish to leave the EU, could devolve out of the UK (and therefore the EU), whilst remaining in the Kingdom of the British Isles. We would all still be British citizens under the Queen and sovereign parliament in Westminster. 
London, NI and Scotland could remain in the EU.
This would be cheaper, simpler, more flexible and quicker than Brexit.
We request that the UK government hold a referendum on all realistic options for the relationship between the UK and the EU.

attributes.action: Remove Southern Railway's Franchise For Causing So Much Chaos & Disruption
attributes.background: Repeated delays and cancellations due to low staff levels has left many late and stranded. With an over complaced complaints procedure, Southern Railway customers have been left out in the cold with slim chances of any compensation.

attributes.action: All NHS employers to pay staff at least the living wage.
attributes.background: Some of the lowest paid NHS staff are working below the living wage. Please sign and support this petition

attributes.action: Debate within 100 days the Government's costed plan for the UK to leave the EU
attributes.background: Good governance requires such a momentous change of national direction to be underpinned by a properly formulated plan with specific objectives, milestones for the change process and timescales for final delivery, detailed costings and an associated risk management plan.
attributes.additional_details: The people of the United Kingdom must be informed of the plan and its detail debated in Parliament within 100 days.

attributes.action: Allow immigrants to vote in UK national elections and referendums.
attributes.background: The scapegoating of immigrants during political campaigns narrows the debate, hides the true reasons for economic problems, and distorts the result. If immigrants were granted the vote, as they are in local elections, they would not be targeted in this way.
attributes.additional_details: During the 18 September 2014 referendum on Scottish independence, all EU and Commonwealth citizens resident in Scotland aged 16 or over could vote. During the 23rd June 2016 referendum on the UK's membership of the EU, immigrants from the EU were not allowed to vote, though commonwealth citizens were. The campaign focussed unduly on the issue of immigration to the detriment of other important issues.

attributes.action: Call a referendum so London can decide to be part of the UK or remain in the EU.
attributes.background:
London, as defined by all postal codes with a LONDON prefix, voted by overwhelming majority in the recent European referendum to remain part of the EU.  

We, the undersigned, believe that London should be allowed to decide its own future as separate from the rest of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
London and its population has stronger ties to Europe than it does to England.  e.g. our dependence on financial services.

London voted by a similar margin in favour of Remain as Scotland.  By the same right that Scotland has to now decide its future, so does London. 

Our population is significantly more European and culturally diverse than the rest of the UK.

London gives more to the UK in tax revenue than the UK gives to London.  We would be stronger if financially independent.

attributes.action: Veto Turkey joining the EU until they cease their illegal occupation of Cyprus
attributes.background: In July 1974, Turkish forces twice invaded and captured the island of Cyprus and now illegally occupy 40% of it. Cyprus is a member of the EU and Turkey wish to join. Countries that occupy member states illegally cannot join the EU but Turkey will be allowed to unless it is vetoed.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_invasion_of_Cyprus

attributes.action: Scrap the tv licence fee of £145.50 and change it for an NHS fee for £145.50 phh
attributes.background: We're always saying we have not got enough money for the NHS well let the bbc pay for itself by advertising and change the fee for a NHS fee set in the same format as the TV licence by each household paying either yearly quarterly monthly or weekly. I know what I would rather pay for

attributes.action: Build a gas-powered station at Hinckley Point instead of a nuclear station.
attributes.background: The South West needs a new power station to avoid blackouts in the next decade. It is increasingly clear that a nuclear station cannot be completed in less than 20 years. The enormous amount of money saved can be spent developing tidal power in the Severn Estuary. It is time to think again.
attributes.additional_details: We need low carbon base-load power. Nuclear would, in theory, provide this. However, tidal power could provide a better, safer solution. The sister nuclear stations at Olkiluoto 3 in Finland and Flamanville in France are billions of Euros over budget and years behind schedule. There is no reason to think Hinckley will be completed on time and to budget. EDF know this, both governments know it and the Chinese require an indemnity from us because they know it. We can build an LNG dock for the gas.

attributes.action: More beds available in the Burnley/ Blackburn mental health inpatient units
attributes.background: Too many people lose their lives due to the lack of resources within the mental health sector. One of the biggest problems arising at the moment is the lack of beds available in the Lancashire inpatient mental health units. These beds could save the lives of those who need immediate help.

attributes.action: Raise motorway speed limit to 80mph with a minimum of 55mph.
attributes.background: We advocate raising the speed limit on motorways and dual carriage-ways from 70mph to 80mph and setting a minimum speed of 55mph to reduce impeding the flow of traffic and cause of sudden braking.
attributes.additional_details: Motorway speed limits were originally designed in the days when vehicles could not break in time. We advocate raising the motorway limit to 80mph. Drivers travelling under 50mph impede the flow of traffic, cause a nuisance to other drivers and can cause vehicles to have to brake hard increasing the chance of an accident.

attributes.action: Make disability awareness a regular thing taught in schools
attributes.background:
As a 14 yr old teenager with cerebral palsy who uses a wheelchair I know that bullying can be a regular thing for disabled people.

I believe that something needs to be done therefore we need to teach more young people about disability in order to reduce bullying and ultimately lack of awareness

attributes.action: Release Government knowledge of extraterrestrials
attributes.background: The amount of sightings and people coming forward about interaction with beings of the years must mean the government be aware of it and keep information.  The release of of so called secret files by the MOD  was low level rubbish.  It's time for the truth. We have been lied too long enough.

attributes.action: Abolish the CCG system established in 2013
attributes.background: In 2013 the Government abolished PCT's in order to create "local" Clinical Commisioning Groups (CCG's).  This system is floored in so many ways. Patients are at risk under this system, Expertise have been scattered leaving huge gaps in our services, CCG's hide behind badly managed CSU's.
attributes.additional_details: I propose that an urgent review is undertaken by the Health Secretary. The CCG's must be regulated by the CQC if they are to continue. I have multiple case studies of Patients care being put in severe danger due to the poor conduct our CCG's insist on operating. They REFUSE to communicate directly with services they commission, refuse to pay their bills and refuse to provide life dependant equipment because of cost. URGENT action is required before someone dies!! Our NHS is at risk!!

attributes.action: Make appropriate sex education for LGBT+ people mandatory in schools.
attributes.background: We, as young people, have very limited access to sex education in school...so when it comes to sex education regarding LGBT+ people, there is essentially nothing! This needs to change or more than just people's education could be negatively impacted. People's health could be at great risk!
attributes.additional_details: We had to visit specific charities and organisations to receive any information regarding LGBT+ sexual health. This is just not okay as it puts people at risk and creates a separation between peers (solely due to their sexuality/gender).

attributes.action: Make June 14th Falklands Liberation Day
attributes.background:
This year marks 34 years since the Falklands War. 
The invasion of the Falkland Islands occurred April 2 1982. 
The conflict ended June 14 1982. 
We believe that to mark our Armed Forces bravery and sacrifice, this date should be known as Falklands Liberation Day
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that the Government should mark the liberation of the Falkland Islands and name June 14th Falklands Liberation Day.
To mark our brave Armed Forces' bravery, courage and sacrifice, we believe  this should be officially recognised.
The Falklands Islands mark Margaret Thatcher Day every year. They have the right to self determination.
It is now time to mark this in our own calendar.
Make June 14th Falklands Liberation Day.

attributes.action: Increase government funding on organisations aiding terminal illness patients
attributes.background: Hospices and other organisations dedicate de to aiding those suffering from terminal illnesses such as dementia or cancer have been undervalued, either by a lack of pay or by an equal lack of resources, together we can increase welfare funding for such organisations such as these to beneficiaries.
attributes.additional_details: Organisations that enlist the aid of care professionals often being undervalued is often being seen in our headlines, our media is very biased in the covering of care workers and thus fewer people are as inclined to openly support the patients, their familles and carers through more comprehensive grief counselling and resources to truly allow these people a chance to live happily and find contentement despite any terminal illnesses.

attributes.action: Invest in Tidal power instead of Dangerous Nuclear Energy
attributes.background:
UK Govt. to Invest in the creation of the Severn barrage and scrap plans for Hinkley Point. The Severn project is renewable, clean energy, it will also provide 5% of the UK's energy requirements, create 50,000 jobs and can be built within just 10 years. 
Nuclear is dirty, profit driven & dangerous.
attributes.additional_details:
Some facts & quotes about the project.

''The electricity generated would be equivalent to three or four nuclear power stations and thousands of wind turbines & equivalent to 8 large coal-fired power stations. ''

- Lower cost than Hinkley Point.

- The barrage will have an operational lifetime of up to 200 year.

- It would be the world's largest ever renewable energy project.

-  Damages to wildlife from project can be avoided with additional investment of £3 Billion to migrate wildlife.

attributes.action: Work with major chains to ban non-recyclable coffee cups ending up in landfill
attributes.background: In the UK over 2.5 billion take-away coffee cups are placed in landfill every year. The public are wrongly led to believe that these cups are actually recyclable (i.e. through environment friendly logos on the packaging). This is a major issue resulting in huge amounts of waste
attributes.additional_details:
'A conservative estimate puts the number of paper cups handed out by coffee shops in the UK at 3bn, more than 8m a day. Yet, supposedly, fewer than one in 400 is being recycled'.

I propose that the Government actively works with major coffee chains and retailers to explore the use of environmentally friendly coffee cups. As part of this, non-recyclable cups should be banned or a tax placed on them to encourage the use of 'cups for life' and bringing in a national awareness of the problem.

attributes.action: Lower Child Support where no Staying Contact, unless Child Protection issues.
attributes.background: Welfare Benefit Reforms mean the parent getting Child Benefit after separation can access the systems to get up to the income the law says they need.Child Support is not counted for means tested things, but more has to be paid if there is no Staying Contact, encouraging ex partners to try to stop it
attributes.additional_details: In the past 3 months there has been several cases on the Separated Dads Forum, where ex partners are opposing staying contact, just to get more Child Support. Some have even gone to the extent of false reports to Police/Social Services what then stopped contact for months, while investigation is ongoing. Children need both parents, and the no staying contact amount should only be paid in extreme cases due to Child Protection/Welfare. The starting amount should be based on 53-104 nights contact.

attributes.action: Put and end to UK circuses using animals as part of their 'performances'.
attributes.background: Along with you I feel it is extremely necessary to put an end to the abusive, cruel and unorthodox ways in which animals are treated in order to 'perform' to an audience. Awareness for this issue is preposterously inadequate and a lot more action against this compulsory to make a difference.
attributes.additional_details:
One case study to get a taste of the happens that are kept away from the public is Anne the elephant: 

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1370050/Britains-circus-elephant-Anne-Battered-kicked-stabbed.html 

These animals are put through a life of pain for a number of hours worth of entertainment, surely everybody can see the imbalance in this.

attributes.action: Ensure there are dedicated disability wards for over 18s in hospitals
attributes.background: Our beautiful disabled daughter/Sister age 26 died of Pneumonia and we think the care of the ward could of been a lot better if there was a dedicated ward with 1 to 1 care and trained disability nurses!

attributes.action: The government is to declassify all plans on TTIP & make plans available online
attributes.background: Such a large trade deal should be available for all the public to read and scrutinise, why is it that we are having to request this information into the public eye. We want this information to be accessible to all people, as we all know the consequences of deals made outside the democratic arena.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transatlantic_Trade_and_Investment_Partnership

attributes.action: Call a General Election in 2017.  Brexit needs a plan with an electoral mandate.
attributes.background:
A referendum vote to leave and "take our freedom back" is not a plan - its a protest. We need a plan on how we leave and what we do next.
This plan should have an electoral mandate from us all - Brexiteers and Remainers alike. 
That is the only way to can build a new unity and a strong future.
attributes.additional_details:
We need three things ASAP:
1. The parties (old guard, and maybe new?) should propose their Brexit plan. 
2. A General Election should be called soon - ideally Spring 2017.
3. The plan people want most will receive a proper mandate.
We can make something good happen. We will have to look beyond our party allegiances to do so. Please get stuck in. Share, like, petition, .... or come up with something better than this.

attributes.action: Stay in the EU, enact Proportional Representation, and call a General Election
attributes.background:
Following the referendum on the UK’s membership of the EU, we the undersigned call upon the British government to:

1. Reject the outcome of the referendum and formally state that the UK wishes to remain in the EU.

2. Enact Proportional Representation.

3. Call a General Election.

attributes.action: Remove the Barnett Formula from being applied in the UK
attributes.background: The Barnett Formula does not conform with modern equality as it allow some groups to benefit and others not. We should all be subject to the same rules
attributes.additional_details: No evidence is needed as all facts are published by the UK government

attributes.action: Allow a second referendum on the subject of our membership of the European Union
attributes.background: We believe that the "In" or "Out" choice was too simplistic for a decision of such importance and that clear and unbiased information was not available. We believe that we should have been asked additionally, or instead, "Would you chose to remain within a substantially reformed European Union"?

attributes.action: Honour our Queen by minting coins in real silver
attributes.background: Being a metal detectorist my friends and I find so many beautiful ancient coins that have stood up to being buried for centuries.  The coins we have now would have all rotted away of a similar period, let's honour our Queen by minting a few nice silver coins.
attributes.additional_details: Take a look at the Spinks coin book and you can see many examples of the beautiful coins our Monarchy once had minted in their name. For me to give examples I would need to be able to upload examples of Silver Hammered coins or the Silver Milled ones of more recent times.

attributes.action: Teach anti-racist/bullying and self esteem building classes in schools
attributes.background: In this day and age we have come across more prejudice, xenophobia, racism and bullying.  This has escalated due to recent events.  In order for the future generation of children the most important thing a child should learn is respect for self and others.
attributes.additional_details: We must teach that bullying is wrong, tolerance for others is important for the process of peace. The current situation as we have discovered from recent events from voting out, has left our country in a state of racism, xenophobia and bullying.  We must act quickly to instigate peace and so that the new generation of Brits are tolerance, happier and peaceful people.  We have a country of British people of all races, religions, sexes and we must learn to live in peace and respectful of each other.  Bullying has been a major factor in all schools and the only way to diminish it is to build respect for self and others through classes and build their self esteem. This will have a positive impact for the future generation of British people no matter what race they are from.

attributes.action: Establish London as an independent state so it can remain in the EU
attributes.background: Greater London voted overwhelmingly to remain. A disproportionate amount of our taxes goes to finance other regions in the UK & our economic wellbeing is severely threatened by a decision imposed upon us by others. We wish to cede from the UK & become an independent state within the EU.

attributes.action: Give all British expats and EU citizens living long-term in UK vote on EU.
attributes.background: The EU Referendum Act of 2015 disqualified many people who vote in local or general elections from voting on EU membership. We ask for a reform of the Act, to give franchise on EU membership to all British expats, and to EU citizens residing and paying taxes in the UK for at least five years.
attributes.additional_details:
Commonwealth citizens residing in the UK could vote on EU membership on 23rd June 2016, whilst expats living abroad for more than fifteen years, and EU citizens living in Britain, could not. This disfavours individuals who have fully invested in the opportunities granted by Britain’s long-term membership of the EU. We believe the Act goes against EU rights of free movement and the constitutional, common law of Britain.
We ask for another Act to be passed to allow a new Referendum in which all expats, and EU citizens residing and paying taxes in the UK for at least five years, may vote. If we are to leave or remain in the EU, it must be a lawful decision, reflecting the wishes of our entire society.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for cyclists to use cycle paths where provided
attributes.background: Cycle paths are created and funded for one sole reason, safety to cyclists and motorists, where provided it should be a legal requirement for cyclists to use the cycle paths to reduce danger to them and motorists on UK roads, especially those which are 60mph speed limits.

attributes.action: Create a memorial or name a room within the Palace of Westminster after Jo Cox
attributes.background: Jo Cox MP was a Member of Parliament who dedicated the past year to her community and often fought for more things for Young people. In the memory of her life I propose that the Palace of Westminster name an area, room or dedicate a memorial to her life in her memory.

attributes.action: Make the UK main summer test cricket series, a free to air television event.
attributes.background: This petition is for a ruling, that the main test cricket series of the summer in England or Wales be shown on free to air television. As are The FA Cup, The Six Nations and The Grand National; with a protected, permanent free to air broadcasting status.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition strongly believes that in order to develop the next generation of cricket stars, youngsters need to be able to easily and readily see cricketing heroes, performing at the highest cricket level. It is one of our national sports and the entire nation should be able to watch the main summer test match series.

This is one test series a year on free to air television. So this petition feels that this is a fair demand.

attributes.action: Ban the transportation and slaughter of pregnant sows
attributes.background: Tired, terrified and heavily pregnant sows are being transported to abattoirs and  frequently give birth during this harrowing journey.
attributes.additional_details: For many piglets their initial experience of this world consists of lying helplessly on the floor of a vehicle which is carting their mother off to slaughter or falling through slats onto the road below.

attributes.action: The PM to report monthly on progress and initiatives to tackle tax avoidance
attributes.background: We increasingly hear about tax avoidance by the rich and by large companies. We also hear politicians say that they are keen to see this issue tackled but warm words aren't enough, let's see a monthly report, including quantifiable measures, so we can see and track progress in a systematic way
attributes.additional_details: Tax avoidance in the UK reputedly costs the UK £16 billion a year. It is not fair and it should be tackled rigorously by the Government and the Prime Minister should be held to account personally

attributes.action: Ban Angela Merkel from entering the UK.
attributes.background: More innocent people have been killed by terrorists, this time in Brussels. There have been more attacks since Angela Merkel opened her arms to immigrants, some of which have been proven to have been terrorists. The vetting process has been inadequate. This will only get worse without action!

attributes.action: Use the Sugar Tax income to fund a Healthy Foods Voucher scheme for all.
attributes.background: Poor nutrition in our country often comes down to affordability. A Healthy Foods Voucher Scheme, funded by the Sugar Tax income, would make healthy foods more affordable. These vouchers could include Vegetables, Fruit, Eggs, Meat and Fish for all households and be exchangeable by any grocery outlet.

attributes.action: Ban the use of retractable dog leads exept on beaches or fields away from roads.
attributes.background: There isn't a day goes by where I almost wrap a dog around the wheels of my car because the owner fails to retracts the lead enough to stop the dog wandering into the road. I'm a dog owner, I love animals, walk them on a retractable lead by all means, but do it away from traffic and risk of death.
attributes.additional_details: Some people may be unable to let their dog off lead, and want to give the feeling of freedom to their believed animal, this is understandable. However it's not only death or seriously injury to the dog which is at stake, a car swerving and avoiding the dog could cause harm to pedestrians and other road users, this has happened to me many times but luckily I've avoided any harm.  I know someone who's dog was killed when his wife used a retractable lead on a residential street, it's avoidable.
